decks.notes: The key strategy of this deck is to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Endbringer using Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Chalice of the Void and Relic of Progenitus to control the game and protect its threats. Karn Liberated and All Is Dust provide additional removal and board control options, while Walking Ballista offers a flexible win condition. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient threats and disrupt their game plan to secure victory.

The deck focuses on cycling through cards to quickly fill the graveyard with high-cost creatures, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Street Wraith, Faerie Macabre, and Architects of Will to cycle through the deck, while also using cards like Demonic Dread and Violent Outburst to set up the Living End combo. By quickly filling the graveyard and then suddenly bringing back a board full of powerful creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

This deck aims to aggressively control the game by using targeted discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By efficiently using cards like Serum Visions and Thought Scour to draw and filter through the deck, the player can quickly deploy threats like Death's Shadow, Tasigur, the Golden Fang, Street Wraith, Snapcaster Mage, and Gurmag Angler. With removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate, as well as countermagic like Stubborn Denial, the deck can maintain board control while applying pressure with its powerful creatures.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp, Golgari Thug, and Faithless Looting. This will enable you to bring back powerful cards like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard, triggering their abilities. Utilizing cards like Life from the Loam, Cathartic Reunion, and Conflagrate will help you keep the engine running smoothly. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a continuous stream of creatures and burn spells, ultimately leading to victory through sheer card advantage and board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total in order to pump up Death's Shadow, a powerful threat that becomes larger as you lose life. By utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize to help lower your life total, you can potentially have a massive Death's Shadow on the battlefield early in the game. The inclusion of disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Stubborn Denial help keep your opponent on the back foot while you close out the game with aggressive creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck seeks to be fast and efficient, aiming to win the game before the opponent can fully set up their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total in order to put Death's Shadow on the battlefield as a powerful threat. This strategy is supported by cards like Thoughtseize and Serum Visions to control the opponent's hand and draw cards efficiently. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate help clear the way for Death's Shadow to attack, while cards like Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command provide additional utility and value. This deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to increase the power of Death's Shadow, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with efficient removal and hand disruption spells. It aims to control the game with a combination of powerful threats like Tasigur and Death's Shadow, backed up by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial. The deck seeks to apply pressure early and keep the opponent on the back foot, using its own life total as a resource to gain an advantage in the match.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. It also utilizes powerful Eldrazi lands and colorless mana sources to ramp up to its high-cost threats. The deck includes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void to control the opponent's spells and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt graveyard strategies. It also has removal spells like Dismember to deal with threats. The deck aims to win the game quickly by playing big Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while controlling the board with cards like Karn Liberated and All Is Dust.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo using cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, which can then be used to either pump up a Walking Ballista for a lethal attack or to repeatedly activate abilities like Scavenging Ooze's graveyard hate. The deck also utilizes a Creatures Toolbox approach, with cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to search for important creatures like Fiend Hunter or Kitchen Finks to disrupt the opponent's game plan or gain incremental advantage. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient creature interaction and a versatile combo potential.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deplete your own life total to strengthen Death's Shadow and other delve creatures, while disrupting your opponent's strategy with hand disruption, removal spells, and countermagic. By efficiently utilizing your life total as a resource, you can apply pressure early on and finish the game quickly before your opponent has a chance to stabilize. This deck aims to be aggressive and proactive, forcing your opponent to react to your threats while you control the pace of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to rapidly generate a powerful Death's Shadow creature on the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Death's Shadow, while also controlling the game with versatile spells like Serum Visions, Thoughtseize, and counterspells. The deck leverages the graveyard as a resource through cards like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Snapcaster Mage, providing multiple lines of attack and defense to secure victory against various opponent strategies.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand and graveyard while playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures to quickly close out the game. It uses cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Tidehollow Sculler to strip away key cards from the opponent's hand, while also using Relic of Progenitus to disrupt graveyard strategies. The Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer provide a fast clock for the opponent to deal with. The deck also includes some removal spells like Dismember and Fatal Push to deal with threats on the board.

The core strategy of this Abzan Aggro deck is to apply early pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Grim Flayer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes removal spells like Path to Exile and Fatal Push to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the board. Additionally, the deck can generate card advantage and additional threats with cards like Liliana of the Veil and Lingering Souls, allowing it to maintain its aggressive game plan while controlling the board.

The deck focuses on utilizing rituals and cantrips to generate mana and draw cards, while utilizing Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance to reduce spell costs. The key strategy is to cast Gifts Ungiven to search for combo pieces like Past in Flames and Grapeshot to generate storm count and finish off the opponent in one explosive turn. The deck aims to chain together spells, generate mana efficiently, and ultimately win the game through a storm combo.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures. It utilizes cards like Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage for card advantage, while also employing powerful threats like Restoration Angel and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker. With access to a diverse range of spells in blue, white, and red, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence and ultimately outvalue them in the long game. The key is to carefully manage resources and make strategic decisions to outmaneuver the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Wild Nacatl, supported by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile. The deck also utilizes cards like Noble Hierarch and Collected Company to increase its tempo and out-value opponents. The land base is optimized for consistency and mana fixing, allowing for a smooth curve of threats. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and resilient game plan, applying constant pressure and utilizing powerful synergy between its cards.
